intro: Alyssum tetrastemon, commonly known as the four-stamen alyssum, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other flowering plants known for their cruciform flowers. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, arranged in clusters at the ends of the stems. Alyssum tetrastemon is characterized by its hairy, upright stems and small, lobed leaves. It is often cultivated as a ornamental plant for its delicate appearance and ability to attract pollinators.
